thread.title: Osborne Upbeat About China Despite Market Jitters
thread.title_full: Osborne Upbeat About China Despite Market Jitters

title: Osborne Upbeat About China Despite Market Jitters
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Sun, Sep 20, 2015, 16:22 BST - UK Markets closed Osborne Upbeat About China Despite Market Jitters By (c) Sky News 2015 | Sky News â€“ 10 minutes ago View Photo 

The British Chancellor has arrived in China for a week-long visit aimed at boosting trade, political relations and cultural ties. 
George Osborne says that, despite the "troubles" seen in the Chinese stock markets only a few weeks ago, the country's growth is still "absolutely phenomenal". 
China's contribution to world GDP has risen from under 2% in 1990 to almost 15% last year but its top index, the Shanghai Composite, lost more than 40% of its value in the two months to September. 
A surprise currency devaluation in August has added to fears that the Chinese economy may be slowing more sharply than was expected earlier, putting Beijing's 2015 growth target of 7% at risk. 
Mr Osborne told Sky News: "Some would turn away from China because of those troubles but I say, 'Let's turn towards China, let's do more together.'" 
The Chancellor is travelling with business and cultural leaders in the week-long visit, which will take him from Beijing and Shanghai in the country's east to the far west reaches of Chengdu and Urumqi. 
On Tuesday, he will visit the Shanghai stock exchange. 
He is expected to announce cultural exchanges and exhibits, along with new investment projects and financial deals. 
Mr Osborne hopes the visit will pave the way for UK businesses to win a far greater share of the growing Chinese market . 
"Britain can have a golden decade of growth with China and we can be China's best partner in the west and that's what I'm determined to achieve," he said. 
Mr Osborne's trip comes ahead of next month's state visit to the UK by Chinese President Xi Jinping.
